description.narrative: East Europe Foundations projekt "Partnerships for better energy use in Ukraine", bidrar till att öka kapaciteten hos lokala beslutsfattare och företagare så att de har verktyg att planera, utvärdera och implementera strategier och projekt som leder till energieffektivisering i Lviv regionen.

The EEF project, "Partnerships for better energy use in Ukraine", will build the capacities of local government and business leaders to plan, evaluate, implement and measure community-driven energy efficiency strategies and projects. EEF will piloting this initiative in Lviv oblast of Ukraine, and it will seek to attract other funds from other sources as well.

The project has one overall impact goal of "Local communities are increasingly able to implement energy-saving projects (through the example of Lviv oblast)."Their are four impact outcomes:1: Local authorities are increasingly able to implement (i.e. plan, manage and evaluate) energy-saving projects.2: Local authorities apply tools for energy-saving planning at the oblast level.3: Oblast stakeholders (government, business and households) are increasingly able to attract investment into energy-saving projects.4: EEF helps local stakeholders implement reforms oriented at sustainable development of their communities.

description.narrative: The Partnerships for Better Energy Use in Lviv Oblast project implemented by East Europe Foundation (EEF) in partnership with Lviv Oblast Council and Lviv Oblast Administration has concluded in 2017 with most of the objectives set forth in the project document moderately successfully achieved. Local authorities are increasingly able to plan, manage, implement and evaluate energy-saving projects.- The project approached the issue through the targeted support to selected entities and then dissemination of the results to the oblast level. For this goal two pilot cities (Zhovkva and Kamianka-Buzka) and a pilot economic sector (Healthcare Department of the Lviv State Oblast Administration) were selected through an open competition to provide energy audits and implement demonstration projects.- Strategic diagnostics of energy-related expenses and energy audits of communal infrastructure and heat supply system accomplished in the pilot cities and economic sector; potential savings were estimated.- Demonstational projects in the pilot cities were implemented (complex thermal modernization of kindergartens in Zhovkva and Kamianka-Buzka, and Lviv Oblast Blood Transfusion Center), and enhanced with additional measures, including installation of heat pump, solar collectors, individual heating units. - Implemented energy saving measures will save 785 MWh of energy per year, reduce ??2 emissions by 183 tons per year, and decrease energy expenditures by 944 thousand UAH per year.- Preliminary data shows that demo projects resulted in significant savings of energy resources, e.g. Kamianka-Buzka reported on 4 times reduction in heat energy consumption in October 2017 compared to October 2016. Local authorities apply tools for energy-saving planning at the oblast level.- Local governments representatives from Lviv oblast were trained in energy saving planning, prioritizing, implementation and evaluation.- Strategic diagnostics provided the pilot cities with necessary data which were used to develop modernization plans for energy infrastructure in Zhovkva and Kamianka-Buzka.- The Program of Energy Saving for the Lvivshchyna Public Sector for 2016 – 2020 was approved by a decision of the Lviv Oblast Council No. 168 dated 31 May 2016 (the program was drafted with the support of the project experts).- Energy monitoring software was purchased and introduced for oblast and pilot cities communal infrastructure. Users (persons responsible for entering information about the energy monitoring site and everyday entry of energy consumption data for this site) and administrators (persons responsible for administration of the energy monitoring system) were trained on its use. Energy monitoring software was complemented with mobile-based automatic collection of energy consumption information for six sites. Oblast stakeholders (i.e., government, business and households) are increasingly able to attract investment in energy-saving projects.- Lviv Oblast officials were trained and received methodological and consulting support in attracting funding for energy efficiency initiatives.- EEF helped Zhovkva and Sambir cities to attract additional EUR 1.4 million to implement further energy-efficiency demo projects (reconstruction of a municipal heat supply system, including switch to alternative energy, and modernization of street lighting system in Sambir).- Over a million hryvnas of additional funding for boiler house modernization at the Lviv Oblast Blood Transfusion Center was provided by the oblast budget based on the energy audit outcomes.- Several additional project partners were attracted, namely EY company, Association of Energy-Efficient Cities, Association of Local Governments “Euroregion-Carpathians”.- Project coordination council was established to oversee the project implementation in terms of content and timeliness of scheduled activities.- General public was informed on the existing incentives for introduction of energy efficiency measures for households and businesses. Wider audience was informed about the project through the numerous press events. EEF institutional development- EEF drafted and implemented its strategy for 2015-2017, and started the process of the development of a new strategy for 2018-2020. - Institutional capacity development program was developed.- A training center was created, roster of trainers compiled, video presentations developed on: Results Based Project Design and Management, Designing and Conducting Effective Development Evaluations, Effective Data Collection, number of trainings conducted for EEF staff and partners.- A new EEF office manual with updated policies and procedures was drafted and introduced.- New 1C-based integrated accounting system, which allows to produce consolidated financial reports and increase financial transparency of EEF activities, was launched.- EEF has redesigned its website.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
